meanings.definition: The state or condition of being unfair.
meanings.sent1: The unfairnesses in the game made everyone upset.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the unfairnesses at work anymore.
meanings.sent3: The unfairnesses in the race were so obvious, it was like watching a comedy show.
meanings.sent4: The unfairnesses in society are like dark clouds overshadowing our progress.
meanings.sent5: The unfairnesses of the situation lingered in the air, heavy and suffocating.

meanings.definition: Instances of unfair treatment or behavior.
meanings.sent1: He experienced multiple unfairnesses during the trial.
meanings.sent2: The unfairnesses she faced only made her stronger.
meanings.sent3: The unfairnesses in the classroom were like little annoying bugs buzzing around.
meanings.sent4: The unfairnesses of life can sometimes feel like a never-ending storm.
meanings.sent5: The unfairnesses of the system were like sharp thorns pricking at their sense of justice.
